The Department of City Planning (DCP) plans for the strategic growth and development of the City through ground-up planning with communities

column1: The New York City Department of City Planning is a great place to work – cultivating intellectual inspiration
column2: professional development and creativity. Visit our website at www.nyc.gov/planning to access the full listing of job opportunities and to learn more about our great agency.

column1: THE DIVISION:

The Public Facilities and Records Management team in the Land Use Review division (LUR) reviews public facility and affordable housing applications as well as manage the records of the agency. The latter of those responsibilities includes maintaining and enhancing the quality of the data in the agency’s application database. The Zoning Application Portal (ZAP) is a database of all the applications submitted to the agency since the early 1970s with functionality to manage current projects. The Zoning Application Portal database is integrated with a public portal (ZAP Search) where members of the public can view information on land use applications
column2: an Applicant Portal for applicants to submit applications electronically and a Land Use Participant (LUP) Portal for community board and borough president staff to submit recommendations electronically.

column1: Team responsibilities include reviewing and responding to data quality issues submitted by the public
column2: other agencies and DCP employees. The team assists these stakeholders in using the ZAP suite of applications/portals.

column5: UN DESA is implementing a project to foster Caribbean SIDS-SIDS peer-learning and cooperation on Data for Nature to accelerate the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

column1: After the global failure to meet the Aichi Biodiversity targets during the previous Decade

column1: In line with priority #2 of the Call for Action (data for nature) and the call for increased SIDS-SIDS peer-learning and cooperation
column2: UN DESA (UN Statistics Division and the SIDS Unit of the Division for Sustainable Development Goals) has developed a program called Data for SIDS (DATAS). DATAS can be tailored to specific sectors (such as biodiversity) and its objective is to strengthen the capacities of National Statistical Systems and to produce better and more timely data to inform policies in an integrated manner and monitor progress towards achieving the SDGs through support for data governance
column6: and SIDS to SIDS collaboration. Particularly
